  91. I've been using this straightener for a few weeks now, and it's okay, but I wouldn't recommend it. In fact I'm surprised that it has so many 5-star reviews. If I had to do it over again I'd order a different one. Here's why:<br /><br />1. It doesn't sit flat on the bottom. It falls over, burns stuff - it's unstable. It's rounded on the bottom and there is no easy way to situate it so that it doesn't.<br /><br />2. It doesn't really destroy frizz all that well. I have wavy, thick hair - not super thick, but thick - and am often dealing with frizz. My old 2\\" straightener, which I'd been using for years and didn't have ceramic plates, did a WAY better job all around.<br /><br />3. It does pinch and pull hair a little.<br /><br />4. The plates clamp tighter at the front end than the inside end, which means uneven styling and again, possible pulling/pinching. Perhaps this is due to the \\"floating\\" plates?<br /><br />5. A small complaint, but it always turns on to the same temperature - 370. I always have to readjust, it doesn't remember the temperature I always use.<br /><br />6. This is hardly a complaint, but I have had very little success in curling my hair with this iron. I don't know if it's a combination of some of these issues or what. Everyone uses straighters to curl hair these days so it's not that uncommon, so just thought I'd mention it in case you were considering using this iron for that purpose.<br /><br />A few good things:<br /><br />1. It does heat up quickly.<br /><br />2. The lock feature is convenient and if the bottom sat straight it would be even better.<br /><br />3. It does, in fact, straighten hair.
  92. I love this hair straightner...it gets hot pretty quickly and was not expensive at all for the quality.
  93. After my $50 dollar Remington broke after 2 years of frequent use, I was convinced that the only quality straighteners that existed were ones that were $50+, like the John Frieda and the Chi. Fortunately, I was very wrong. This straightener works really well, and the price is fantastic! (I have long, med-thick hair) Pros: - Heats up quickly - Shuts off by itself after an hour (you don't have to worry about accidentally burning the house down!) - Cute color - Straightens hair well, and doesn't get caught in your hair - Leaves hair with a smooth appearance - The buttons are located in a convenient place so you don't accidentally turn it off during use Cons: - Smells bad when you turn it on, but the smell goes away eventually Overall, I definitely recommend trying this straightener! One of the best purchases I've made on Amazon thus far. Go for it.
  94. It works great, I've been using an old one (maybe 3\\" wide) and this straightener works even better with a smaller surface. Very worth the money, and slides really well and doesn't pull. (It's more of a matte rather than shiny finish.) I took away a star because I did notice a strange burning smell coming from the iron. I have had another hair straightner that was 2 inches by Remington and I must say it didn't heat up near as quick as this one did. If your like me, I have really thick, natural curly hair and sometimes it takes me 3-4 times to get my hair straight which can be frustrating and very time consuming. This little gadget only took me a total of 5 minutes to straighten my whole head with shoulder length hair. :) It doesn't pull your hair like some of the other ones do and its easy to press together which is advantage for me b/c I suffer with severe arthritis. The temperature settings come as if you were setting the oven to cook something, 325, 330 degrees and so on, so be careful when you pick it up because it does get very hot as soon as you turn it on, it's also small enough that you can take it with you if you are a person that does lots of traveling. Also, this makes your hair really soft and a little shiny and I have well water and I'm always looking for products that will soften my hair. So, if you are reading these reviews all of them hold true about the product and I'm a very picky/particular person when it comes to buying things, especially online! Hope this helps for those of you looking for a good hair staightner. :)

I have thick, wavy hair, so I use the hottest setting (410 degrees) and I only have to go over the same section twice to get it perfectly straight. I've never used this on wet or damp hair - I wash at night, let it air dry while I sleep, and straighten in the morning (meaning my hair is a MESS and this thing does the trick).   145. I was looking around for straighteners myself, but I found $90 a bit pricey for a \\"good\\" flat iron. I found the reviews on here very promising, so it was an easy choice. I found it for $15 at Wal-Mart. They had plenty to go around there and it was convenient. I am surprised at how lightweight it is so you can hold it for long periods of time and it's easy to wield.<br /><br />Something about the small size makes me feel like it's just so cute! It performs very well, especially for the price. It has 6 settings at 310°, 330°, 350°, 370°, 390° and 410°. The numbers appears on a blue LCD that blinks until the temperature desired is reached. The cord is long enough so you can move around freely and has a swivel to make things easier.<br /><br /> I have thick, curly, long brown hair and it takes only 10 minutes to complete. I don't expect to have extremely straight, glossy hair like they show in commercials and I definitely can't achieve the look of someone who has naturally straight hair, so you probably shouldn't either for $15. That said, it tames my hair and gets it relatively straight which is a feat in and of itself. I've tried a more expensive flat iron by Paul Mitchell at a salon and I can't see much a difference. I might be doing something wrong as I'm a bit new in terms of beauty stuff as I'm somewhat of a tomboy, but I don't think I am.<br /><br />In closing, if you want an economical flat iron that works well, this is your best bet. As long you're not one of those people who is expecting miracles, you will probably be satisfied. I'm sure someone with thinner hair will have better results than I have had os that should be more incentive to get it.

Most straigteners (including the one typically used at home) are limited to 110V, making them not suitable for use abroad. However, this one works in both the UK and mainland Europe (with a plug adapter, of course). It's also fairly small and the performance of this was pretty good -- especially for the price.

  204. Initially I thought about spending a ridiculous amount of money on a new flat iron. I decided to try this one out first and I couldn't be happier with the price and the quality!
  205. Ok, so I'm new to the world of hair flattening, well, new to doing anything at all with my hair other than brushing it and sticking it in a ponytail. Recently decided \\"Hey, I wanna look nice\\" so I got my hair cut, I love those choppy Asian hair cuts that are so popular these days, thought I could pull it off, even though I'm white... blonde... and have extremely wavy hair. So, my formerly past shoulder, single length hair is now extremely layered and still past shoulder length, and turned curly from all the lost hair weight... Looked like Joe Dirt of Farrah Fawcett. Bought a Revlon flat iron, took forever to heat up, and several sloooow passes through each section to get it even remotely flat, we're talking 45 minutes to straighten my hair! Then that one started acting funky, either would not heat, or would only stay heated for a few minutes, yesterday after only 6 uses it died completely. So, considered giving up the ghost and going back to looking like a slob all the time, but found this Remington flat iron affordably priced here on amazon. Ordered with with the Prime 2 day shipping and it was here in less than 24 hours (sweeeet) just HAD to try it out immediately and it literally took under 10 minutes to completely flatten my hair, this is including the time it took me to read the instructions on it. So many pros to this flat iron! You can lock the buttons on it so you don't accidently change the heat setting during use, the digital display flashes while it's heating, when it stops flashing you know it's ready. I used it set on 350 and it only took a single pass through each section. Another great feature is at the base near the cord is a lock so you can lock the plates shut during storage, less ricks of it breaking this way. I love this flat iron. Also, if you're a newbie to the flat iron world like me, there is so much more you can do with a flat iron than straighten your hair, check out BubzBeauty on YouTube, she has tons of easy, well explained/demonstratedhair tutorials.

  239. I love purple, so this product definitely caught my eye. The digital temperature LCD makes me feel like I'm using some really expensive straightener, but in reality it is so affordable. Features three temperature ranges for fine, normal, and thick hair. The swivel cord is nice and long. First the blue LCD keeps flashing as it tries to make its way up to 370. I didn't adjust the temperature.<br /><br />As other reviewers have noticed, it only takes minutes to do your hair. This thing is SO fast. I consider my hair normal/ easy to style and was attempting to use this straightener to put waves in my hair. It was so hot I had to work fast. Each strand was done in 2 seconds. I was scared if I took any longer the straightener would burn through my hair. At one point I left it for a second longer and steam came out. My hair was completely dry so that was definitely not the greatest surprise. Heat Protectant spray is a must!! Next time I will put it on the lowest temperature setting. The waves/curls turned out great, the plates didn't catch/pull my hair at all.<br /><br />It has buttons for you to adjust temp up and down, an off/on button, and a switch for you to lock the straightener closed.<br /><br />Cons: the packaging is terrible. It's made of strong plastic so the product is protected, but it's a nightmare to cut through the plastic. My scissors were worn down. While the iron was heating, a smell akin to melting plastic arose. That is not good. I hope it's only temporary- should have wiped the plates down. Lastly, the back of the straightener gets very hot. You may wonder why anyone would touch there, but it helps when turning your hair. Hopefully it doesn't just melt and break down on me. We shall see.<br /><br />UPDATE: After using this product multiple times over the course of a year, I am still very happy with it! The \\"melting plastic\\" smell has disappeared, and the plates still go through my hair smoothly without catching.

Not heavy to hold and use. Takes about 10 minutes to straighten and add waves to medium length hair curly frizzy South Asian Indian hair. Hair stays straight for two days after. Remington has once again stayed true to their reputation of not compromising on quality within the affordable range. Happy hair styling!
  285. This flat iron gets too hot. (whoa - there is such a thing?) My hair dresser said you shouldn't go over 200 degrees or it will damage your hair....and this one doesn't go below 310. I wish it went lower. I've used a cheap flat iron for years that didn't get too hot and still worked on my thick hispanic hair, until it junked out on me. This was cheap so I bought it. It works well...I wish I had the option of using a lower temperature.
  286. Absolutely wonderful for the price! It straightens just like my $200 straightener did, the only complaint is the auto shut off is more like 30 mins than 60. Overall I'm very satisfied.
  287. I'm overall happy with this hair straigtner but it only lasts part of the day for me. I have naturally wavy hair that curls up more and more as time goes by. When going over it with the flat iron that is usually enough to keep it straight for the rest of the day but it doesnt always last the whole day. There's also a sliding lock to keep the straightener closed when not in use - which would be great when storing it so that it is more compact and less likely to break.
  288. My hair type is thick (a lot of hair) Wavy 2A but is horrible to style. The smell was bad at first but went away. I loved how it straightened my hair (on the lowest setting) and even after shampooing it, it still kept a straightness to it. For hard to manage hair I originally LOVED this because it cut my styling time down significantly. BUT, after time I could no longer wear it wavy because I would straighten it daily. I did not read the advice about getting a heat protectant and now I have fried not fully straight somewhat wavy hair (not cute at all!). I have not found a good heat protectant so have stopped using this until I find something to protect my hair (which has always been very pretty so I am now annoyed that I have fried hair). If you have fine hair FIND A HEAT PROTECTANT. If you always want straight hair then it's a good hair straightener.

I used my Aunts babyliss for about a week, and I LOVED it. I'll be getting one in a few months but this one is great for the mean time!! It is a nice sleek design, and the purple is nice. It goes up to 410 I think, and doesn't take long at all to heat up. I have thick, somewhat wavy hair. It will clump together looking very stringy if I don't straighten it. I don't have insane curls or frizz/poof, so I don't know what the result would be if you used this straightener- but if you have it at the right heat setting I'm sure it won't let you down! The price is great. Deff. not one of those \\"you get what you pay for\\"... great great price. I do have bad split ends from my damaged hair, it doesn't cause any.. but make sure to use a heat protectant, no matter how healthy your hair.<br />Hope this review helped your decision.<br /><br />STARS: I only gave 4 stars because yes it is a great flat iron, but doesn't really compare to the Babyliss I'm just in love with!   315. It delivered really quickly, 2 days after I placed my order with Standard shipping. Anyways, it works great so far and is definately worth buying. I am Asian and I have combo hair, so I have both thick,course and super fine hair. On both so far, it works great. I used to own the Bed Head Ionic straightener but the buttons were on right on the grip and it was a hassle using it. Compared to the other straighteners, here are the pros and cons: Pros: ~Heats up pretty quickly ~SWIVEL CORD! you don't have to worry about the cord getting tangled when you use it ~Discreet LOCK button. Some pple complained about it not having a lock button, it does. it's at the hinge so it's not exposed. ~3 buttons instead of a whole dial pad of them. Screen lights up as well ~Little smell. The others I've used always had a bit of smoke and burnt smell on the first use. Cons: ~Design is somewhat bordering ugly. The pictures looks nice and shiny, but actually it has a very matte finish. It is very simple and plain. Personally I don't care about it but some people do. ~Limited choice of temperatures. The temperature settings are set, you can't use anything in between the set temperature values they have (310,330,350,370,390,410 degrees) ~Only goes up to only 410 degrees. The Bed Head Ionic one i had could go a bit higher. Over all, I definately recommend this to anyone who wants to try it. It is seriously better than other straighteners if you're on a tight budget. It's worth being a straightener under 20$
  316. This product is with me for more than a year, Works very well !! Love this sleek straightener!!

  332. I absolutely love this straightener!! I've been straightening my hair for about 8 years now so I've owned a few different straighteners over the years. This one was the cheapest I've ever purchased so that was a huge plus. I also love how quickly it heats up. I set mine to 390 degrees and it only took 30 seconds to finish heating. It's great how it lets you know when it reaches the heat you want it to so you don't have to keep checking every few minutes if it's the right heat. So now to the actual straightening... I have really thick hair (my mom has thick wavy hair and my dad has thick curly hair so I was born with a nightmare combination of the two). It's also pretty long but it only took me about 5 minutes to straighten it properly. I really only had to go over each section once which was nice and saved alot of time. I'm still in the honeymoon stage of owning this product so if there are any problems I haven't encountered them yet. Keep in mind that it will smell funny the first few times you use it. That's just the film burning off the ceramic plates and it won't last past the second or third use. I would definitely recommend this product to all my friends!

  340. I got this in kind of a rush and just wanted to try it - one of those purchases where I honestly didn't expect much, and I was pleasantly surprised!<br /><br />The pros~<br />This straightener gets the job done quite nicely - I have thick wavy medium length hair that's very prone to frizzing, and just setting it to 370 (the default temp) got my hair straight in no more than one pass, gliding over perfectly. I was done and over with the straightening process in less than 15 minutes, and that's just beautiful on my book! It also left it feeling incredibly soft and so far I haven't seen a hair stick out - anti static working perfectly. It also has a nice little feature of auto turn off after an hour, which is amazing for a scatterbrain like myself.<br /><br />The cons~<br />It does smell. Boy if it does! As soon as you plug it in and turn it on it starts to give off this weird burning smell. at first I was worried the cable was broken or something, but after checking it thoroughly I just decided it was the default smell and I couldn't get rid of it. It's not that bad once you get used to it, and it's really no deterrent for me. It also heats up incredibly fast! While this could be point in favor, you really need to pay attention to the temperature you choose and where you lay it on as you wait, even if it's for a brief moment - it heat up in matter of seconds (10-15) and I almost melted off my phone case. Oops! Lastly, the chord isn't too long. It's probably around 6 feet which isn't too bad, but for someone who likes twirling around the room while doing their hair, it just fell short.<br /><br />In the end it's a terrific buy for the price (less than $20?!) and I am very happy with it. You really can't compare it to a super high end brand, but I do recommend it for anyone looking for a handy straightener (curls nicely too!) for not very much.

However my journalist daughter Lucy Bryson has beautiful golden tresses, and she has kindly agreed to do the testing and let us know. It sounds pretty good to me, but Here's Lucy (between quote marks)<br /><br />`These straighteners are a fantastic product for the price. Slim and compact, they heat up extremely quickly, making them a good buy for anyone who, like me, tends to do everything in a bit of a last-minute rush.<br /><br />The straighteners have quite a few nifty features, not least of which is the fact that you can control the heat setting very easily. There is a digital temperature display, and you can boost or reduce the heat depending on your preferences. It's advisable to use a hair protection product even at the lower temperatures, though.<br /><br />Another handy extra is the heat-proof pouch which comes with the straighteners, so you can store them straight away without worrying about burning or melting any surfaces or bags.<br /><br />My one gripe is that the lock and unlock feature on the straighteners is a little fiddly to use at first, but I did get used to it after a few days' use.'<br /><br />Sounds all right to me.

It's light weight and slim which is perfect for traveling. I've never owned a digital iron but so far I like controlling what temp to fry my hair. If i blow dried my hair before i can lower the temp-if i let it dry naturally i can up the ante to 410. It is possible to curl your hair with this iron-I'm just not very good at it. I don't know if this straightner will last as long as my Chi but for the price i paid and the results i'm getting i wouldn't mind if it lasted only a year or two. I needed an extra pass with this straightener but that's a small price to pay- ofcourse it will take me a little longer than the usual 15 minutes it normally takes me to get my mid back length hair straight.   382. I am a guy (straight, not that it matters; just sayin) and have somewhat experience with straighteners before this purchase. One of the plates moves, the other does not. They don't meet perfectly with a very light squeeze. Is this a problem?? Well, as long as you aren't 70 years old, and decrepit with arthritis, you should be fine.. just squeeze a little harder?! Heck, there is even little places at the end if you look close that don't get very hot, you can pinch those together too (be careful at high heat setting though!). I understand you ladies have MUCH more hair than I do so it might hurt your hand after a while doing your whole head. BUT, THIS STRAIGHTENER IS $17 PEOPLE! You expect it to be like the BaByliss Pro Nano (which is literally $100.00 more) for $17?!? This is meant for someone who doesn't make a living off of the way your hair looks.. If you want a VERY nice one, spend the money for it.. Don't get me wrong this works very well indeed. I only used the lowest setting and mixed a bit of pomade in my hair to style it and I LOVE IT. My hair just needs to grow more haha. If you want a straightener AND be able to afford to feed yourself and still be happy with the results, get this. If you want something that pinches perfect, goes wet to dry, wider plates; get a more expensive one? It gets hot and makes your hair straight, isn't that what we all wanted?? Not gonna lie, I kinda like the color too, it grew on me lol. Oh, and yes it made a plastic smell when I first used it but I didn't smell it after that first few minutes. I can't comment on how long it will last, but I imagine as long as you don't abuse it; it'll last AT LEAST a year. Pretty sure everything you can buy in America has at least a 1 or 2 year warranty if its not snapped in half or the cord is cut. Don't be dumb.<br /><br />*Don't write reviews bringing down a product that hasn't claimed to be in the rankings of the products &#60; $100 more.. It's like me doing a review on a BMW M3 and a HondaCivic saying the Civic wasn't close in certain areas. -smacks forehead, duh!- Just because you wanted to save $20-30 bucks and didn't like the cheaper version you ended up getting, it's not the products fault; don't get it one star jeeze. I gave it 4 stars because I don't think it's perfect, but very nice. I would like the tips of the purple plastic to be half an inch longer for you females to have more room to pinch and hold the ends while you straighten your hair.
  383. Although there is a strange metallic smell that comes from the iron, it gets super hot and makes my hair pin straight in no time.
  384. Compact and very easy to use, gets the job done, try it out. I like it a lot glad I bought it

  398. I am going on a trip to Germany and wanted to buy a dual voltage hair straightener that I could bring with me that would work in Europe so that I would not have to bring my expensive hair straightener and risk it getting ruined with a voltage converter. The ONLY reason why I decided to purchase this straightener was because the product details said it was dual voltage. However, after receiving and opening, the product states that it is 120V and therefore NOT dual voltage. This was a complete waste of $30 (I also paid for 2 day shipping) as I cannot return since in order to open the package to find out it was not dual voltage, the original packaging was destroyed (it was sealed plastic, not a box). As it turns out, the Remington S9951 is dual voltage which I went out and bought at Target. So if you are looking for dual voltage DO NOT buy this product. Despite what the product description says, IT IS NOT DUAL VOLTAGE.

  429. This is a great hair straightener.<br /><br />My hair is thin and a little wavy. So this is what my review is based on. If you have thick curly hair, you would probably be wise to invest in a more expensive straightener.<br /><br />PROS:<br /><br />Temperature control<br />Lock - so it stays closed when not in use.<br />The cord is very long<br />Price!<br />The cord into the back of the straightener is curved at a 90 angle and will rotate so that if you set it on the counter the cord will hang straight down and not be in the way. However this doesn't work with they way my bathroom is set up.<br /><br />I have owned this for over 2 months and use it 2-3 times a week. It heats up super quick. 30 seconds or so. And it takes me maybe 2 minutes to straighten my fine wavy hair.<br /><br />The plastic casing does not get too hot to touch and it doesn't snag or burn my hair.<br />If you get lines in your hair then you need to learn how to use a straightener.<br /><br />My roommate has a CHI flat iron and granted it is better. The plates are smoother and it is heavier and seems like it is just a better products.<br />However not THAT much better to justify spending $90 - $100 when the Remington does just about as well.<br />This also makes a great travel straightener as it is cheap, lightweight and rather sturdy.<br /><br />I would recommend this product to anyone looking to buy their first hair straightener.
  430. To start off, I haven't purchased a new hair appliance in about 5 or 6 years before today, nor a straightener specifically in 7 or 8, so I understand that they all have changed in even their basic forms in just the past few years. I have looked at straighteners on and off for the last 2 years or so but I knew I would mostly want one now for my daughter. She is mixed and has very curly, very dry, and VERY frizzy hair, no matter what kind of products I use or what I do to it. (Although, on that note I also tried a new deep conditioning treatment for the first time, Pantene ProV for Curly hair, and that alone made her hair amazingly soft!) I generally go for blow drying with low heat to prevent damage, but doing just enough to keep it from being a tangled poofy mess as when left natural. Anyway, before even using the new hair treatment I bought, I tested a few pieces before giving her a bath. I was IMMEDIATELY impressed. I couldn't believe, in just one QUICK pass (and with little tension put on the hair), how it came out so straight, smooth, SHINY (her hair is never shiny without some kind of oil product applied), and with a great weighted \\"hang\\" if you get what I mean... just the way straight hair hangs differently than curly, with that flippy-ness to it. So, after washing/treating her hair and letting it dry, blow drying a little but just enough to speed up the drying process, I went through her hair in about a half hour. It takes so long with her because she's 5 and no 5 year old sits still well at all. So, to me that was about a 100-150% improvement in time. It takes longer to blow dry her hair! And with my old straightener (What I believe to be Conair's first steam straightener, a big bulky white one... anyone remember those?) it would take about an hour and it was hardly straight... the plates didn't get hot enough anymore. Anyway, I could go on and on about all the differences between 5-10 year old straighteners and those of today. I am surprised to see theseproducts actually getting BETTER (even among the cheap ones) rather than worse, like many other products. I have no idea how this compares to other similar prices or more expensive products, but if this is considered \\"crap\\" among them then it is still about 1000% better than those just a little older. But as far as inexpensive ones ($30 or less to me) go, after reading reviews before purchase I figured this one had to be at least decent. I love everything about it! The digital temperature control (other popular ones I see have a dial on the inside of the handle and, though I figured it must still be way better than any of my \\"one temp only\\" appliances I still wanted digital if it was still inexpensive. It's so easy to use and very well designed. I don't have any issues with accidentally hitting any buttons, so, though I LOVE the fact they thought of a way to lock the temperature selection, I find I don't even need it. I see complaints on reviews about the hinge lock... I don't see a problem with it personally. I closed the straightener, pushed in the lock, and it doesn't come open. I did have to push it in a tiny bit hard (and equally so in opening it again) to make that final click that says it's secure, but it wasn't anything irrational. The plates are SO smooth on the hair! I'm sure there are better ones out there but, again, if this is among the worse ones it's still great IMHO. I didn't have ANY snags in my daughter's hair, and compared again to my old straightener I didn't have to go as slowly down the hair or apply nearly as much tension to actually get it straight. I never had to run it through a section of hair more than once except for two instances, but both being a fault of my daughter where she moved too much and there was a line in the middle of her hair. One quick swipe through again and all was fixed. Also, despite her usually needing high heat, I achieved BEAUTIFUL results on her hair at the 350* setting on the finer pieces of hair and 370* setting on her coarser and more stubborn pieces, both temps being in the mid range. I just love this straightener so so much! After experience with my OLD OLD straightener, I wasn't planning on using it on myself (I have naturally wavy hair that stays well with very little styling), but I think I might play around with doing my own hair again! It is effective and efficient with minimal damage to hair, AND it is pretty on top of it (just a bonus!). And also MUCH lighter, smaller, and less bulky than older, less effective hair straighteners. Thank you for such a wonderful product!
  431. I switched to Remington after my Conair straightener lost its straightening abilities. I have extremely thick hair and this straightener makes my hair pin-straight, and reduces static! It's a miracle worker & will buy this straightener again once it gives out, which won't seem to happen for a while.

  433. Great product, great price, great service!
  434. I like the features that this has, such as it will store closed, the automatic shutoff timer and the fact that it tells you when it's heated. However, the plates are not uniform when shut. If you close them, the side closest to the end will be touching but as it gets closer to the other side (where your hand is) it starts to open slightly. This forces one to squeeze more so that this middle area will be closed tightly over your hair(especially if you have fine hair like I do). If you have ANY hair in the area at the end, it will be be squeezed even more, catching the hair. As you slide the straightener downward, those hairs get pulled. OUCH! This is my only complaint, but it's a big one. Since this did get so many positive reviews, I'm wondering if it's a quality control problem; I just happened to get a bad one. :(
  435. I have been using $100 hair straighteners for about 5 years now. I accidentally stepped on my straightener and broke it in half a week before my college graduation which I REALLY wanted to straighten my hair for. I couldn't afford to spontaneously spend $100 on a straightener so I bought this one and I am actually very impressed and hope to continue using it for years to come.<br /><br />My hair type is not thick but not thin and it's pretty straight for the most part, but if I don't straighten it, it gets kinks and also waves at the end that I don't like. This straightener is perfect for my hair type, and gets the waves out and makes my hair pin straight at the lowest heat. Because the plates are cheaper than the ceramic or gold plates you get on the more expensive straighteners, I can tell that it is being more rough on my hair, but I always make sure to spray my hair with a heat shield and I've found no more significant damage to my hair than I would get before.<br /><br />So, for someone looking to save money yet get the same outcome from a hair straightener just to get the kinks and waves out of your hair, this straightener is PERFECT! I will never spend more than $100 on a straightener again, in fact with this one, I'll never have to spend more than $20! :)

  460. To start off with, my hair type is very thick dark blonde, with ringlets in front with a wide wave in the back, plus outrageous frizz. Humidity is a sworn enemy. To tackle these problems, I turned to flat irons years ago, but didn't do the every wash/dry/flat iron routine until just over a year ago. Then I had a Cricket flat iron, a gift from my mother who paid a pretty penny for it, so that did the job. Not the best job in the world, since I still had some frizz and unwanted volume. Maybe it was the iron, maybe it was my technique, who knows.<br /><br />Anyway, just about a month ago, I was doing my hair when I grabbed the iron too close to the plates, burned myself, and dropped the iron and broke the ceramic plates. To replace it, I came on Amazon to check prices and reviews...and found this beauty.<br /><br />This iron, for the price, the power, the features, and yes, the color too, is the best iron I've owned. Hands down. I want to give it 4.7 or so stars, but can't have partial stars to rate with, so I just gave it five stars overall. to make it easier, here are my pros and cons:<br /><br />Pros<br /><br />- When it says \\"30 second heat up\\", it really means only 30 seconds to heat up! When I turn it on, the screen lights up and flashes to indicate it's heating before glowing solidly when done. 30 seconds is really all it needs, and I use it at 370 degrees!<br /><br />- The plates are very long while only an inch wide. I have no problem with this as I can spread out my sections pretty thinly for the best results. It only takes 2 swipes minimum to the do the job right the first time. The only times I repeat beyond that is to go over the crown of my head and for the ends since they are the hardest to keep straight.<br /><br />- The temp controls are perfect. As for my old Cricket, I had a hard time fixing the temp the way I liked it since I could barely see the figures on the dial between the plates. The heating was inconsistent as it would need to reheat constantly after two sections of hair. With this iron, no reheating, only steady temp all the way. The temp is displayed on the screen with big numbers for easy viewing with bright backlighting.<br /><br />- This might not count as an actual pro to anyone else, but I love the color. I'm a fantatic for all things purple, and I'll admit, that was a final deciding factor for me when purchasing this since it went with my other purple styling tools.<br /><br />Cons<br /><br />- I have very few problems with this iron, but I will say that they do exist. One is the smell. When heating, one does smell a vaguely burning smell from the plates. I've noticed this every time I use it, but maybe it will go away over time.<br /><br />- Secondly, your hair will smoke when using it. Again, every time I've used this iron, I have seen smoke and the hair is piping hot when released, so I recommend being VERY careful when handling your hair unless you want to be partially burned, depending on the temp used.<br /><br />- Lastly, my one true beef witht his iron is that the bottom of the iron is not completely flat. It's rounded on both sides of the iron, so if one isn't careful when setting the iron down, it may tip over onto something or the countertop. All I can say is be mindful of how you handle the iron, especially when you set it down.<br /><br />Overall, I really love this iron. For the below 20$ pricetag and the power it has, I am supremely satisfied. The smaller problems are easy to overlook in place of the benefits. Before, I had to douse my head in straightening sprays and creams, but still come out with a frizzy mess. With this iron, I actually get what I want in terms of manageable hair. It's smooth, soft, very few flyaway strands, and sometimes I just can't help but run my fingers through it to watch how it slips and slides like silk. Worth it, so very worth it!ly after two sections of hair. With this iron, no reheating, only steady temp all the way. The temp is displayed on the screen with big numbers for easy viewing with bright backlighting.<br /><br />- This might not count as an actual pro to anyone else, but I love the color. I'm a fantatic for all things purple, and I'll admit, that was a final deciding factor for me when purchasing this since it went with my other purple styling tools.<br /><br />Cons<br /><br />- I have very few problems with this iron, but I will say that they do exist. One is the smell. When heating, one does smell a vaguely burning smell from the plates. I've noticed this every time I use it, but maybe it will go away over time.<br /><br />- Secondly, your hair will smoke when using it. Again, every time I've used this iron, I have seen smoke and the hair is piping hot when released, so I recommend being VERY careful when handling your hair unless you want to be partially burned, depending on the temp used.<br /><br />- Lastly, my one true beef witht his iron is that the bottom of the iron is not completely flat. It's rounded on both sides of the iron, so if one isn't careful when setting the iron down, it may tip over onto something or the countertop. All I can say is be mindful of how you handle the iron, especially when you set it down.<br /><br />Overall, I really love this iron. For the below 20$ pricetag and the power it has, I am supremely satisfied. The smaller problems are easy to overlook in place of the benefits. Before, I had to douse my head in straightening sprays and creams, but still come out with a frizzy mess. With this iron, I actually get what I want in terms of manageable hair. It's smooth, soft, very few flyaway strands, and sometimes I just can't help but run my fingers through it to watch how it slips and slides like silk. Worth it, so very worth it!

I think I can straighten all my hair in 5 to 10 minutes, depending on style (I have shoulder-length hair). The cord is long too, which is great! The adjustable heat settings are really easy to use too (+ raises the temp and - lowers it). Really couldn't be easier. I use it about three times a week and I love it. P.S. Sure, there were some lower reviews, but there were also a LOT of 4-5 star reviews--and a piece of junk isn't going to make that many people happy. I'm so glad I did! It's been great! It gives my hair a nice, crisp look. There have been a few times when I pinched the iron too tightly that it snagged my hair at the very bottom, but usually it slides over my hair very smoothly and leaves a really nice hair style behind. :) The iron feels sturdy and the area where you're supposed to hold the iron stays at a comfortable temperature. This is the first flat iron I've used, so I can't compare it to any others, but there's nothing that I find irritating about it or would want to change. I couldn't be more pleased with the results I'm getting! (And it's so FAST and easy to use!) :)

All straighteners damage your hair, but this one tends to do minimal considering you don't have to keep running it through your hair over and over again to achieve your look. I did one section of my hair with a curling iron and the rest with this flat iron. Within hours, the one small section I used the curling iron on was almost straight again. At first, I forgot and was like WTF but then I remembered, oh yeah, that was the curling iron. I officially rolled it up and threw it in the back of my cabinet. I am only keeping it for emergency purposes. I used to blast this flat iron on high because that's how I roll but then I decided to tone it down. I usually have it on 370. The complaint I have is that the plates aren't super smooth and if you aren't careful it will leave a crease in your hair where you started straightening.   578. I've had some medium priced straighteners, some expensive ones, and have been using a wide paddle Bed Head straightener for about three years now. This week the lights went out on it. Last weekend, I chopped off all my hair. I thought, after reading all the great reviews, I'd give this little, inexpensive, narrow straightener a go. I curled my hair with my Bed Head 1 in curling iron this morning, but this straightener smoothed and flattened my strands super quickly. It gets hotter than a person could ever need and very quickly. I usually need super hot irons to get my fine hair to behave, but this iron goes above and beyond. Recommend, as others have, to start at a lower heat setting. 370 or less is working for me. Doesn't add shine, but what straightener really does? Is that what we're really looking for? You just can't beat the price for the quality. Hope it lasts a long time. I was really satisfied with my Bed Head tools, but this one is keeping up very well.

It gets them straight and they stay that way for a few hours. Humidity or water will usually put a wave back in but nothing like the curl I get when naturally dried.<br /><br />I like that this has a setting to choose temperature.   675. A little iffy on what to give it for stars. I have thin short hair (pixie cut) that's not damaged but I feel like this would cause split ends and frying if I used it on a daily or every other day basis. Even at the lowest temp, steam rises off of my dry, just heat protected hair. I'm no hot tools expert but that's a clear red flag for me. This is why I've only used it in passing and not on the regular.<br /><br />It also takes longer than my other Remington to get hot. (I have the Wet to Straight Digital one, from about 8 years back. It works great still and does straighten my hair without damaging it. Makes it look super shiny too. Has multiple heat settings and is overall awesome but is more boxed on the sides. So curling with it is a no go. Enter this one here.) The plastic also feels super cheap and gets hot fast on the outside. Be careful if you are curling and touching the iron because it will burn. All though, all hot tools are this way. (That I've tried or have.)<br /><br />If you are buying this to straighten I would go with another one. I find that when I pull my hair to straighten it, (which may be my own fault but I haven't found a way to not do this.) that it leaves dents where it first started. I hate that, it looks like you had a ponytail holder in your hair or something to that extent. But it curls nicely when properly used. I found that out the hard way, when I was flipping my hair out or in. I also did curls to see if it could since I had to experiment for a while with the flipping and it worked and looked awesome. The ends of my hair much like the beginning look a little stiff and iffy but I can deal. Sometimes it doesn't leave the dent at the end of my curls. I think its more of a pressing to hard thing for me though.<br /><br />I will re-update this when I've had it and used it more to give tricks and tips... hopefully. (If my hair doesn't burn but even then, I will let you know.) Would I recommend. Not for straightening hair. For flipping or curling hair, yes. Oh, it also leaves my hair static free which is advertised in the name!I've had it and used it more to give tricks and tips... hopefully. (If my hair doesn't burn but even then, I will let you know.) Would I recommend. Not for straightening hair. For flipping or curling hair, yes. Oh, it also leaves my hair static free which is advertised in the name!

  680. This is a review for those who are curious about this straightener's performance as a curling tool. I wanted a flat iron for my bf's place that could both curl and straighten my hair while being affordable. This is the cheapest straightener I could find, so I was skeptical. As far as straightening goes, I have gotten better results from other tools, but as long as you go over each section of hair carefully, it definitely gets the job done. For reference, I have thick, wavy hair. I absolutely adore curling my hair with this thing. Because the prongs are curves, it gives a nice, large, even curl that looks very natural and sexy. Think VS model hair. I ended up taking my $100 Babyliss straightener to my bf's house because I like using this one more for curls, which is how I usually do my hair. It does smell a tad odd when it heats up but I can live with that. A total steal!
  681. I just want to add an important note here, because I read many reviews that this straightener will work on dual voltage automatically. When I received the straightener, I noticed that the voltage rate written on it is (120V) only. So I went to Remington website and filed a support ticket, and here is their answer:<br />&#34;Thank you for your message. You would need to look between the handles of the flat iron and see if it's printed on the handle 120/240V. If so, then the unit has worldwide voltage. The older version of the S-5000 has dual voltage but the newer one runs on 120V only. &#34;<br />So please take attention to this point if you want to use this one outside USA.

  717. SHORT: It effectively straightened my hair with no issues. It has a low of 310 degrees, and a high of 410, and the integers you raise the setting by are pretty random. I did not need it to make my hair pin-straight, as I only intended to clearly trim my ends, but on the second lowest setting (330) I was able to do just that. Worth the money for me, and if I ever needed to, I'd buy again.<br /><br />LESS SHORT: I have a large body of thin curly hair. 3b-4a hair if you would like a more specific idea. Waves that are so close together that they are almost coils. Ethnic hair if this helps anyone. I was skeptical that something so small, and cheap could do anything. I've only ever used the older more expensive models that someone else lends to me, so this was new. It will be the first I have owned for myself. You must read your instructions very thoroughly before using. For instance, this is not a wet-to-dry flat iron. It advises you to not use an extension cord, or place it on a soft surface. Small things I have no idea if they actually prolong my flatirons life, but I also won't test.<br /><br /> I have had no issues with it. I've only used it once, on my hair, and my mothers. The more expensive irons do not have temperature control and basically fry your hair. And like I said, there's no point in getting those because this at the lowest setting, worked just as good for me. Also remember to flat iron small amounts of hair at a time. I'm so happy with this iron!
  794. I've used this daily for 4 years now and I love it!!

It left my hair silky smooth, not fried, and I also like that it has a button to lock it closed.   946. Years ago my friend bought me the GHD 1-inch classic styler as a gift. She told me it was the &#34;real deal&#34;. Throughout the years I've used it here and there because I know these tools are damaging. My hair is straight but tends to get wavy underneath so occasionally I like the super-sleek look. One thing for sure the GHD straightener was way too hot. I really didn't like the fact you couldn't control the temperature. I would often turn it on and use it immediately before it had the chance to heat up...otherwise my hair literally became so hot I couldn't handle it. Also, that heat would inevitably create frizz because the underneath of my hair would get so hot and I would sweat and then humidity would do its wonder. Forget trying to use that thing on a warm day or when I was rushing to head out. I would always end up with frizzy fly-aways. And forget trying to use it to create curls. The steam coming off it would always burn me and I wouldn't be able to get more than one rotation without stopping. But like I said, I don't use these tools often so for what it was it worked and I held on to it for special occasions.<br /><br />Moving forward, I recently just cut my hair chin length. Now that it's growing out and starting to hit my shoulders it's doing that weird flip-out thing in different directions. I tried using my old GHD on it but being such a short length I felt it was frying my hair more than ever. I wasn't going to drop a lot of money on something and of course knew Amazon would steer me in the right direction.<br /><br />I'm so glad I purchased the Remington Cermanic Hair Straightener! For under $15 I honestly didn't care what the few bad reviews said or how well of a job it did. And to be perfectly honest - I love it so much more than my &#34;real deal&#34; GHD straightener. The Remington's temperature setting is 310-370 and I find the lowest temp to be perfect for my short hair. Yes, it does have a slight smell like burning metal when you turn it on. I'm okay with that. It's not that bad and goes away after a few minutes. The plates are smooth and glide against my hair better the the GHD. With the GHD the plates would often grab stray hairs at the end and pull them. It wasn't until I used the Remington I noticed how smooth it can be. It doesn't get my hair ridiculously hot and I haven't once broken out into a sweat with it. Which says a lot this time of year where I am because it's gross and humid out already. I haven't tried to use it for curls yet but I truly believe it will do the job with no problems.<br /><br />All and all I highly recommend this straightener for anyone - newbie or not. After years of a professional straightener I'm glad I found something that actually works. You can't beat the price - just buy it!!

The third reason is that it is purple and my wife is wild about purple. The flat iron's ceramic heating surfaces are scratch-resistant, durable, distribute the heat very evenly, and keep a constant temperature for long hair styling sessions. The shape and overall feel of this unit makes it ideal for holding while working with your hair so it is not awkward in any way. The digital readout that shows the temperature is a very nice feature for obvious reasons. You never have to guess if it is really at the temperature that you want it to reach before working with your hair. This unit has a very good feel to it and seems very durable and unbreakable should it ever be dropped. The controls are easy to read, simple, and the control switches/knobs are not cumbersome and in the way. It is a good solid unit and its features are top-notch. So me and my wife both give it a big thumbs-up because when she is happy, I'm happy. I would recommend this flat iron to anyone.

  1074. I am very happy with this straightener so far. It heats up very quickly and I like that it has a digital temperature reading. The plates are narrow enough to allow for easy maneuverability and styling, but not so narrow that it takes forever to straighten all your hair. It slides easily over my hair which allows me to finish straightening all my hair in just a few minutes. The only slight downside I have seen so far is that every time you plug it in, you also have to press a button to turn it on and then set the temperature (it defaults to 370 degrees.) I am sure this is the same as many other straighteners, but the one I previously used turned on automatically upon plug-in, so this has just been something for me to get used to. I have never owned the higher-end straighteners like the Chi so I can't really compare it to that, but I doubt you could find a better straightener at this price point.

  1158. I ordered this flat iron after reading some of the great reviews by other customers and because it was significantly cheaper than the higher end straighteners out there. But you truly get what you pay for with this product--a veritable piece of crap. I was extremely disappointed by the overall quality of this flat iron. The biggest issue is that the ceramic plates are not aligned correctly and do not meet fully, so when the flat iron is clamped down the plates come together at the top but gradually get further apart closer to the handle. This makes the quality of the straightening suffer (I was not impressed by the straightening ability of this flat iron whatsoever) as well as your hand hurt applying pressure on the handle to try and get the plates to meet.<br /><br />My advice is to invest a bit more money in a high-quality flat iron with which you will certainly be more satisfied than this one.

The digital reader flashes to indicate that the plates are heating up to the temperature on the screen. I only wish it could be set lower than 310F, but I must say, it straightens hair really well. I love the peace of mind from the 60 minute auto-off feature. Overall, a great buy for a great price.
  1253. If you are looking for an inexpensive hair straightener, this one does the job. However, when I press the power button to turn it on, there is no light or indicator that the unit is on, other than the temperature display that shows the temp that the unit is set to. Then, when I push the power button again to turn it off, the temp display stays on, so I am not sure if pressing the power button has turned the unit off. It would be nice if there was a light indicating whether or not the power is on. I just unplug it when I am done using it, so it is not a huge deal. You get what you pay for, and this is an inexpensive model, but again, it straightens my hair, and that is what I need it for.
  1254. I'm actually really surprised at the high reviews on this flat iron. It takes two to three strokes per hair segment to reach the smoothness that one stroke could do using another brand. I give it three stars because it still works and it is not expensive.
  1255. My old iron broke so I bought this hoping it would be awesome considering how many people reviewed it and it still had a high rating. I was excited because of the price as well. After using it I can see why it's so cheap.<br /><br />- I had no problem straightening my hair with it. No major pulls or snags. It didn't glide extremely well over my hair, but it wasn't uncomfortable.<br />- The controls are easy to use and it heats up quickly.<br />- My biggest problem was the smell that emitted from it while heating up. It was a horrible plastic smell, which I hoped might go away after a few uses. I used it maybe three times and each time the smell was just as strong as before. I could have put up with it, except for the fact that the burnt plastic smell clung to my hair. So through out the day I kept getting whiffs of it. If it wasn't for that it would be a pretty decent flat iron for 15 bucks.<br />Also, It was described as having floating plates in the description. Just so you know only one plates actually floats.. the other is stationary.

  1276. I don't know how I ever lived without a flat iron! And this Remington was a great deal. I bought it elsewhere for a few dollars more after my stylist recommended a one-inch flat iron. There were so many options and some flat irons were very pricey. So I bought the Remington because it was my first and I didn't want to spent a whole lot on something that may or may not be worthwhile. It turned out to be such a great buy. It hits 410 degrees (and is temp adjustable) and turns itself off after two hours (I think it's two hours) if you forget. I use it on maximum heat 410 degrees for this one, and it reaches that fairly quickly.<br /> I usually have smooth hair that I blow dry straight. But, living in a humid environment, my hair can get unruly, wavy, flip out and generally be a headache when the weather stinks. My Remington has eliminated that problem. I use a leave-in styling gel (I didn't know you weren't supposed to) and Fredrick Fekkai cream heat protectant, just a slightly bigger than pea size that I work through my wet hair. After I blow dry, I go over my hair with the flat iron and I'm good to go, no matter the weather. And it lasts -- no matter the weather. Of course dry weather always is the best for hair, but I appreciate a tool that didn't break the bank. I recommend it. Why spend a fortune on a product just because it's got the name?

  1313. I purchased this straightener about two weeks ago, after my other straightener finally died a slow and painful death (that involved some weird buzzing and finally refusing to heat up beyond lukewarm). I'll start with the packaging - it sucks. I handed the package to my fiance, told him to be The Man, and was handed back the unpackaged straightener. I recommend you find someone else open yours, unless you're into clamshell packaging and/or ripping your hands to shreds.<br /><br />The product itself is a lightweight 1-inch porcelain hair straightener. It boasts a 60-second warm-up time, and that's no joke. I am thoroughly impressed with the speed of the heat up. The straightener has a power button that you have to hold for a few seconds in order for it to respond. This can be confusing at first, but once I realized I needed to hold it vs a quick press, I've had no issues.<br /><br />Once turned on, the user has the ability to adjust the heat to a level that is suitable for your hair. The packaging included directions, which contained tips and a heat guide for your &#34;type&#34; of hair. Definitely useful!<br /><br />My hair is thick and while not overly frizzy, certainly needs professional strength heat in order to be tamed into submission. Previous straighteners have done this with a LOT of effort (burned hair, anyone?), and the results never last more than a few hours at best. The Remington S5500 straightened my hair perfectly, and much to my amazement the results lasted into the next day.<br /><br />The cool-down time is also fairly quick, for anyone who is wondering. The Remington also has a lock, so that once closed you can keep it that way for storage/safety. Smart, I really enjoy that feature.<br /><br />The color is jsut an added bonus, but really, I adore this straightener. I am so glad to have chosen it.

  1319. Light but solidly made, easy to handle, heats up quickly, and works like a charm! I have shoulder-length, thick hair, and I asked my hairdresser the best way to use a flat iron. She advised me to &#34;rough dry&#34; my hair (head upside-down, just dry without thought to styling), section it off, and, working from the bottom of the scalp to top of the head, straighten a section at a time. Takes less than 10 min. to iron. This has revolutionized my hair (no joke!). Wish I had this info 20 years ago! Great item, and am hoping it works in Europe!

  1370. I've been using this straightener for several months now and I must say that it works surprisingly well! After having 2 Chi brand straighteners before, I was hesitant to purchase this one. But it was much more reasonably priced and it works the same as the Chi's I have used in the past.
  1371. The \\"Remington S5500 Digital Anti Static 1 Inch Ceramic Hair Straightener\\" is an excellent hair styling tool and an even better value. It is lightweight, an attractive color, and very reasonably priced. It heats quickly; one pass through my fine, medium-thick hair is enough to create a smooth, shiny surface.<br /><br />While I am happy with the \\"Remington S5500 Digital Anti Static 1 Inch Ceramic Hair Straightener\\" as a styling tool to use while traveling, Remington should consider improving several features. The control switches are somewhat recessed; those whose fingers are not nimble or who have larger fingers may find them difficult to push. Having those buttons project just a bit further would improve the tool. When the straightener is heating up, all three bars located on the digital readout flash; once it reaches the desired temperature, the number of bars associated with the temperature shows as solid. It would be nice if the number of bars associated with the selected temperature flashed while the unit is heating. Finally, the automatic shutoff time is one hour. I believe a shorter time would be safer as a fire might start if something flammable was in contact with the unit for an hour.<br /><br />I like the \\"Remington S5500 Digital Anti Static 1 Inch Ceramic Hair Straightener\\", but have deducted one star because of the perceived shortcomings.
  1372. Bought this for my daughter. She said it heats up very quickly and it was an awesome price. She is very happy with it.
  1373. I had initially given this iron high marks for durability, high heat, and it's dual voltage. I still think it's great, but these \\"floating plates\\" are just no good. The surface of the plates have also deteriorated quite badly after only a few months of use - and I only use an iron once or twice a week so it's not exactly wear an tear. While it's been okay, I won't be buying another one.
  1374. This is not a dual voltage flat iron. It appears in amazon's search list of dual voltage flat irons but it does not support dual voltage. It supports only 120V.
  1375. I have this more than two years now, it still works fantastically

But this heats up immediately and, on the highest setting, gets my hair perfectly straight with just one pass through. I feel like this helps minimize any damage to my hair, because I only have to go over each section once and don't have to hold it for very long.<br /><br />My one complaint is that the outside of the straightener is curved, so you can't really put it flat on its back. Maybe not a huge drawback during normal use, but it would be nice to be able to unplug and set it down to cool in a way where I wasn't a little worried the plates might touch whatever surface it's on (which is how I feel when I put it on its side).<br /><br />Still, for this quality and this price... In terms of how quickly a person will get split ends, I believe that it depends on a variety of different factors (how frequently you straighten, if you're blow-drying and straightening, how high the heat temp is, and whether or not you're using heat protector of any kind on your hair). I read somewhere that as you straighten your hair you should use the lowest possible heat setting, and aim to do one slow pass of the section of hair instead of going over the same part several times. I also use a heat protector and don't straighten my hair every day. Thus far I'm very happy with the product and recommend it.

  1566. my teen girls like it a lot
  1567. Cheap and does the work!
  1568. Flat irons are a natural girls best friend or worst enemy. I'm honored to tell you that this little purple double bladed gem and I are getting BFF bracelets engraved tomorrow. Man, what a fantastic device this is! First off, I'd like to coat this review with a little back story on my hair. For the first 12 or so years of my life, my parents greased, hot-combed, shampooed, and conditioned my hair every 3 or 4 weeks. And at that stage my hair grew like a weed. Luscious locks of well-loved hair sprouted from my well-cared-for scalp. If my hair was growing almost divinely, then hell hath no fury like a virgin relaxer. And like hell does best, it burned. My scalp and my divine locks of love were toasted, roasted, and lying dead in the sink not even a year later. Ever since then it's been an embarrassing battle of trying to get back all of that love and adoration I got for having such gorgeous hair. I lost friends, I lost respect, I'm pretty sure even my dog rolled her eyes at me once. So like a woman scorned (and burned too) I just gave up and decided that anyone who judged me by how I looked was a shallow idiot with no sense of self worth. And that may partially be true but I now understand that that view was more of a reflection about how I felt about myself and how low my self esteem had gotten since relaxer-gate. So after years and tears of living in the lie that &#34;I don't care how I look, and anyone who does is a dummy&#34;, a compliment from a coworker inspired me to try something new and gave me a much needed new outlook on beauty. As much as I hate to admit it, beauty and fashion are core values to me. I adore creativity and living without my first expression of my creativity for so long left as burnt-out as my hair was. Suffice to say, this device's smooth glide, beautiful appearance, easy temperature control, and easy styling options helped me once again take pride in they way I express myself through my hair. Thanks to this device, much like it's easy tohandle temperature controls, I now realize that I have control over how my hair looks and how I present myself to to world. Thank you Remington! And Look luck to all of my natural, relaxed and everything else in between sisters who are struggling and overcoming just like I did.

This makes the quality of the straightening suffer<br /><br />Advice: Invest a bit more money in a high-quality flat iron with which you will certainly be more satisfied than this one.

  1668. This straightener works very well. It goes up to 410 or some degrees, but I use mine on the 330 setting. I have thin, little bit past shoulder length hair. It is usually straight, but if I'm having a bad hair day it's what I go to! Also I love doing others' hair, and I straightened by friend's (who has thick, wavyish curlyish hair) and it worked really well for her too, and she slept on it and it looked the same in the morning. So that proves that it works well for all different types of hair.<br /><br />The only con is that the outer part (the purple outside) of the heated metal gets pretty hot too. But the very tippy top is okay, so it doesn't really matter to me. It can get hair very straight with just going down the hair once. It is very lightweight which is useful. I noticed that it also kills static when flat ironing the hair. I also really enjoy the lock system on the bottom part of the iron, right near the swivel cord (which I might add, is very good for keeping the cord untangled) so you can definitely minimize the space it takes up. I love it!<br /><br />It definitely is a must for people with all kinds of hair- for daily straightening or just quick touch ups in the morning. For the price and the high quality, you can't beat it at all!

I had another really cheap travel straightener that I had been using for travel, but it didn't get nearly as hot as the Chi, so it took 3 times as long to style my hair. After researching several flat irons I decided to try this one and I am so glad I did. It's dual voltage and it worked perfectly in Europe. It also gets to temperatures over 400 degrees. I have medium thickness hair that is a little wavy. I have the temperature set to 370 and it works just as well as my Chi. More than a year later and it is still going strong. I would absolutely buy again.

  1688. This is the first review I've written after using Amazon for years. I love this straightener. I'd never used one before, and I am very low maintenance when it comes to hair. I have fine, wavy hair that is frizzy and hard to manage. I usually go to bed with it wet and then throw it up in a messy hair clip or bun in the morning. I would never wear it down because it didn't look good, it would always be dull, frizzy, and have volume in all the wrong places. I got this straightener, and I love my hair again. It takes about 10 minutes when my hair is dry for me to straighten it. Afterwards it's glossy, straight, easy to manage, and I look like a different person. I can run my fingers through my hair and it's so soft and easy to work with. This may sound strange, but I actually enjoy having hair again! It's no longer just an inconvenience, it's something I feel good about. This straightener is cheap, quick, easy to use, and makes me look so much better all around! I highly recommend it.

I would spend hours straightening my hair until it was perfect. Then, I would go outside, and BAM, it starts curling again. I also tried blow drying my hair straight, which actually works pretty well, but it doesn't give me pin straight hair. I decided to buy this straightener after seeing the reviews and the low price (I'm a poor college student). I'm so glad I did! The swivel cord, the digital temperature control, and the long plates make it a great straightener. I can curl my hair with this thing too and it looks like I just walked out of the salon (I use 370 degrees to straighten my hair and 350 degrees to curl it). It does straighten well though, and if you like high heat, you'll definitely love this flat iron. If you have fine hair like myself, however, stay far, far, away. I unfortunately did not have the anti-static result(which is why I bought this in the first place), as the high heat made the static even worse. My old Biosilk I normally kept at a 240 degree heat setting because my hair is thin and colored, it took me anywhere from 10-15 minutes to straighten all of my hair and even still there would be static, but with the Remmington I keep it at 310 degrees and in not even 5 minutes I'm done and my hair is perfectly straight, zero static, very shiny and smooth. Less time I have to use the flat iron on my hair = better for me and my hair.<br />The plates glide easily over hair, doesn't snag, pull or tear hair at all, very gentle.<br />The iron itself is nice, small and light weight and even locks so you can store it easily once it cools off. I love the big, easy to read digital display too, my old Biosilk just had an annoying dial.<br />Don't be put off by the low price of this flat iron like I was at first, it really is a great little flat iron and very much worth the (small) price tag!

I usually spend at least 50 bucks on hair tools but decided to go inexpensive because these things die all the time. This is a very good product. Yea it is 15 bucks but it works just as well as the $75 one that died on me. This iron does produce a smell but it does eventually go way. It straightens my shoulder length thick hair pretty quickly only requiring one or two passes. The starting heat temp is 350 and goes to 430. It does have an auto shut off after an hour and only one side of the ceramic plates is movable. The other side is fixed. It has a pretty long cord and it works well. Go ahead and get this iron, if you are on the fence. I was but I am glad I committed.

  1847. I'm not usually one to award five stars to products, but this one really fits the bill.<br /><br />Let me start by introducing you to my hair. I'm Asian, so it's black. It's long. It is thick. And there is a lot of it. That said, I hate spending mass amounts of time primping my hair. Bad combo of high maintenance tresses and laziness.<br /><br />I've used other straighteners before, but this one really takes the hassle and time wasting out of hair styling. Width is perfect both for straightening and for creating loose curls. Temperature settings are great: super hot enough to quickly style, but no issues with burning. Heats up QUICK. Grab is good — I can't stand those straighteners that won't let me grip my hair as I please (not that I'm clamping down with iron force, but you get my drift).<br /><br />I guess my only question is about the limited range of temperature settings. The iron only allows for three temperatures: 370, 390, and 410 degrees. Not that I'm complaining: I usually keep the iron on its hottest anyway. But found this to be curious anyhow.

I have trouble spots that are hard to straighten and this straightener smooths them. This product is not dual voltage, but I didn't buy it for that reason. I have not had this for very long, so I cannot attest to how long the product will work. My favorite part about this is there is no burning smell. I've used it on all three settings and no smell! :)

The plastic gets very hot, so you have to hold it in just the right way while you use it or you risk burning yourself. The worst thing about this straightener, however, is the plates. They are simply not smooth enough to glide through hair, especially if you are trying to use it to curl your hair.   2017. If, like me, you found this item by browsing for a dual voltage iron, then BEWARE. Remington makes (or at least made) a dual voltage version. And Amazon thinks it is supplying that version. But at the very least that is unreliable. I received a 110 only version. Amazon agreed it was their error, and shipped me a second and a third one. All of them are only 110. And these would definately need a transformer - not just a plug adapter - to be used safely with 220. See the description of this other remington iron http://www.amazon.com/Remington-S9950-Moisturizing-Conditioning-Straightener/dp/B001LF4I8I.<br /><br />So while this may be a good iron, you will probably NOT get a dual voltage one. Dual voltage ones SAY THEY ARE DUAL VOLTAGE in the manual and on the item itself.

  2042. thinking this was gonna be a waste of $20, i was soooooo wrong. this is the best flat iron ever. worth the price appose from $100 flat irons -___- but i love this ish, I just got it today and now I'm doing my hair, and I look fabulous!
  2043. Heats up very fast, only need to go over sections maybe twice, smooth and straight finish! Works great on my medium thick, frizzy hair. I would recommend this product to everyone.
  2044. I was a little adamant about purchasing this item when I read the negative reviews. But after doing a little research, I decided to purchase it and this ended up being a great item. First let me just address the concerns regarding the negative reviews. Yes this ceramic straightener does not close Flush. It touches at the end tip and widens as it goes back. This is actually not uncommon as most (if not all) straighteners do not close flush. You actually don't need the straightener to close flush anyways because your hair will touch both blades due to its volume when you grab a bunch to straighten. It's also better for the device if the blades don't touch because if they do, the extreme heat from each blade will cause the ceramic parts to wear out.<br /><br />Now on to the good, this device is light and compact. It comes with a led temperature light so you know exactly which temperature you're using, heats up in about a min, has a swivel cord so no tangles, has an auto shut off in case you leave it on, and has a locking mechanism to keep it close. It works perfectly for me whether I'm straightening my hair or curling it. I've had no problems or issues with it and it's smooth to use. I did have a couple of instances where it was bunching and pulling my hair but that was because I was applying to much pressure on the grip not because of the device itself. All in all its a great straightener at a great price with a lot of great features.
  2045. If you are like me you have an older flat iron that only works half the time and takes ages to warm up. This should be your replacement one, it is well made and heats up so quickly. Straightened my hair with one pass, whereas my other one took 2-3. Has a nifty little lock that keeps it closed when not in use. Worth every bit of its low price!
